page.title: 06LONG ASHTON RESEARCH STATION
page.content: In 1903 the Long Ashton Research Station was built and it was a huge success. It is linked to Bristol University, and its work is to experiment with crops. The two drinks, Ribena and Babycham, were made here, but this is known to very few people. The Research Station is mainly studying cereals now. While the industry is streamlining its management, the staff at Long Ashton continue to do all they can to help directly and indirectly. Now most of the staff use computers whenever necessary. Every year since the Station opened there has been a wassail party, where people sing and watch the Morris dancing. They drink hot soup and eat French bread. This happens after dark, about three weeks after Christmas.
